help.action: The name of the function to call
help.args: The arguments to use. Will be evaluated as Python literals or, on failure, as strings. Stored values may be used by putting the name between <angle brackets>. Pass positional arguments at their position. Pass keyword arguments as `key`=`value`, where `key` is the argument name (string) and `value` its value (evaluated as Python literal or, if that fails, as string
help.store: Store the result of this call in a variable with the name. The model may be retrieved by putting the name in <angle brackets>
help.cmd: Invoke the given command with the result of the execution as sole positional argument.
